content.question: Which of the following best describes the reasoning in Baker v. Carr (1961)?

choices.label: Unequal representation of citizens in legislative districts is unconstitutional and may be reviewed by the courts.
Political issues such as reapportionment, redistricting, and gerrymandering are to be resolved by the legislative branch.
Racial gerrymandering is a violation of the Fourth Amendmentâ€™s exclusionary clause.
Gerrymandering that favors a single party is not subject to legal action because there is no standard to determine how a state legislative district map should be drawn.

content.answer: Unequal representation of citizens in legislative districts is unconstitutional and may be reviewed by the courts.
